The HARQ-ACK codebook may be transmitted through a physical uplink control channel (PUCCH). The HARQ-ACK codebook may be determined or generated such that it includes only HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs. The HARQ-ACK codebook may be determined or generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a larger PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a smaller PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value for each serving cell index. The HARQ-ACK codebook may be determined or generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a higher SPS configuration index for the same PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value and the same serving cell index.

ABS may perform operations according to some implementations of the present disclosure for reception of HARQ-ACK information. The BS may include: at least one transceiver; at least one processor; and at least one computer memory operably connectable to the at least one processor and storing instructions that, when executed, cause the at least one processor to perform operations according to some implementations of the present disclosure. A processing device for the BS may include at least one processor; and at least one computer memory operably connectable to the at least one processor, storing instructions that, when executed, cause the at least one processor to perform operations according to some implementations of the present disclosure. A computer-readable storage medium may store at least one computer program including instructions that, when executed by at least one processor, cause the at least one processor to perform operations according to some implementations of the present disclosure. Referring to FIG. 25, in some implementations of the present disclosure, the above-described operations may include, for example, transmitting SPS PDSCHs based on a plurality of SPS configurations (S2501); and receiving the HARQ-ACK codebook including HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs (S2503). The HARQ-ACK codebook may include HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot having a low slot index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot having a high slot index for an SPS configuration index and a serving cell index. The HARQ-ACK codebook may include the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a higher SPS configuration index for each serving cell index. The HARQ-ACK codebook may include the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell having a lower serving cell index precede all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell having a higher serving cell index. The HARQ-ACK codebook may be received through a physical uplink control channel (PUCCH). The HARQ-ACK codebook may be a HARQ-ACK codebook including only the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs. The HARQ-ACK codebook may include the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHS such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a larger PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a smaller PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value for each serving cell index. The HARQ-ACK codebook may include the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHS such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration having a higher SPS configuration index for the same PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value and the same serving cell index.

The examples of the present disclosure as described above have been presented to enable any person of ordinary skill in the art to implement and practice the present disclosure. Although the present disclosure has been described with reference to the examples, those skilled in the art may make various modifications and variations in the example of the present disclosure. Thus, the present disclosure is not intended to be limited to the examples set for the herein, but is to be accorded the broadest scope consistent with the principles and features disclosed herein.
description.heading: INDUSTRIAL APPLICABILITY
description.p: The implementations of the present disclosure may be used in a BS, a UE, or other equipment in a wireless communication system.

claim.claim-text: 1. A method of transmitting a hybrid automatic repeat request acknowledgment (HARQ-ACK) codebook by user equipment in a wireless communication system, the method comprising:generating the HARQ-ACK codebook including HARQ-ACK bits for SPS physical downlink shared channels (PDSCHs) based on a plurality of semi-persistent scheduling (SPS) configurations; andtransmitting the HARQ-ACK codebook,wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a low slot index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a high slot index with respect to an SPS configuration index and a serving cell index, andwherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a higher SPS configuration index with respect to each serving cell index.

2. The method of claim 1, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell with a lower serving cell index precede all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell with a higher serving cell index.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is transmitted through a physical uplink control channel (PUCCH).
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes only the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs.

5. The method of claim 4, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a larger PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a smaller PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value with respect to each serving cell index.

6. The method of claim 1, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a higher SPS configuration index with respect to the same PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value and the same serving cell index.

7. A user equipment for transmitting a hybrid automatic repeat request acknowledgment (HARQ-ACK) codebook in a wireless communication system, the user equipment comprising:at least one transceiver;at least one processor; andat least one computer memory operably connectable to the at least one processor and storing instructions that, when executed, cause the at least one processor to perform operations, the operations comprising:generating the HARQ-ACK codebook including HARQ-ACK bits for SPS physical downlink shared channels (PDSCHs) based on a plurality of semi-persistent scheduling (SPS) configurations; andtransmitting the HARQ-ACK codebook,wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a low slot index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a high slot index with respect to an SPS configuration index and a serving cell index, andwherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is generated such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a higher SPS configuration index with respect to each serving cell index.

10. A method of receiving a hybrid automatic repeat request acknowledgment (HARQ-ACK) codebook by a base station in a wireless communication system, the method comprising:transmitting SPS physical downlink shared channels (PDSCHs) based on a plurality of semi-persistent scheduling (SPS) configurations; andreceiving the HARQ-ACK codebook including HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs,wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a low slot index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH in a slot with a high slot index with respect to an SPS configuration index and a serving cell index, andwherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a higher SPS configuration index with respect to each serving cell index.

11. The method of claim 10, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell with a lower serving cell index precede all HARQ-ACK bits for an SPS PDSCH of a cell with a higher serving cell index.
12. The method of claim 10, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook is received through a physical uplink control channel (PUCCH).
13. The method of claim 10, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes only the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs.

14. The method of claim 13, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a larger PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH associated with a smaller PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value with respect to each serving cell index.

15. The method of claim 10, wherein the HARQ-ACK codebook includes the HARQ-ACK bits for the SPS PDSCHs such that a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a lower SPS configuration index precedes a HARQ-ACK bit for an SPS PDSCH based on an SPS configuration with a higher SPS configuration index with respect to the same PDSCH-to-HARQ feedback timing value and the same serving cell index.
